test.demo
Class HelloWorld

java.lang.Object
  test.demo.HelloWorld
All Implemented Interfaces:
P2PListener, SearchListener
public class HelloWorld
extends Object
implements SearchListener, P2PListener

Sample peer listens for messages and displays them on the command line.

Author:
A. Nevski and Renault JOHN

In this demo, we want to send a custom message to an other peer to illustrate the routing facilities of the common interface.

main

public static void main(String[] args)
Let the sample peer send a message.

Parameters:
args - the command line arguments to be passed on to the peer-to-peer layer
See Also:
usage

newMessage

public void newMessage(Message message,
                       Peer origin)
Implementation of the P2PListener interface. Is invoked when a new message is received and this node is responsible for the message's destination key. Reassembles the message text and displays it on the command line.

Specified by:
newMessage in interface P2PListener
Parameters:
message - the message received
origin - the peer from which the message was sent

newSearchResult

                            Collection results)
Invoked when a new search result is available

Specified by:
newSearchResult in interface SearchListener
Parameters:
guid - the GUID of the original query
results - a Collection of DataItems matching the original query
